answers.author: Jeffrey Naftal
answers.text:
You cannot really hold department directors responsible for these things unless you have added it to the goals for them for the year as part of a formal (or informal) performance appraisal system.  And while Councils can hold Manager's responsible for these things without any formal system, most Managers have a contract and most municipalities have Charters or Codes that address this in some fashion.  So I don't agree with Joseph's negativity.  If you are a Manager, setting up goals for your staff and asking your Council for specific goals on these matters will go a long way towards removing the uncertainty.

text: Looking for examples of or information on how other jurisdictions hold department managers accountable for overspending their budget.  Any discipline action taken?  Any assistance given to address budget over runs? What action, if any, is taken to hold the manager(s) in line for overspending?
title: Holding managers accountable for overspending budget.
